base_instructions: Translate faithfully while preserving Tolkien’s calm, cozy British pastoral tone.
The narrator’s voice should remain warm, witty, and mildly formal—never melodramatic.
Maintain continuity with previous translated text.
Do not add explanations or commentary.
Return ONLY the translated text in clean Markdown.

style_rules.proper_nouns: Transliterate names and place-names exactly (e.g., 'Baggins' → 'बैगिन्स', 'The Hill' → 'द हिल'). Do not translate creature names (Hobbit, Dwarf, Wizard).
style_rules.vocabulary: Use natural literary Hindi; mix simple words with gentle tatsam only when it improves rhythm. Avoid heavy or archaic vocabulary.
style_rules.tone: Maintain a feeling of comfort and respectability in descriptions of the Hobbit-hole.
style_rules.forbidden: No modern slang, no dramatic exaggeration, no Bollywood tone.
